content: through a stripe or that colour will dominate on the narrow end i recommend cable cast on worked between the stitches because it will match the other edges blog link for cable cast-on http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html row 1 rs kfb knit to last 2 stitches k2tog row 2 ws sl1 pw wyif knit to last 2 stitches kfb s1 pw wyif repeat these 2 row until you have nearly run out of yarn or like the size - whichever comes first you can try it on to check how it sits then bind off on the rs using a larger needle i recommend you try 20 stitches to check the edge before working the whole row the bind-off should create a neat even edge - not too tight and not too loose knit the 1st stitch no kfb this time knit the 2nd stitch lift the 1st stitch over the 2nd stitch knit the 3rd stitch lift the 2nd stitch over the 3rd continue working this way until you get to the last two stitches then k2tog and lift over for the last time pull the yarn through the last stitch to secure two yarn version - alternate yarns every 2 row always pick up the new yarn from underneath don t pull too tightly as you change yarns © susan ashcroft 2013 - for personal non-commercial use only
